meanings.definition: To pull up by the roots.
meanings.sent1: She disrooted the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The storm disrooted the old tree in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit disrooted all the carrots from the vegetable patch.
meanings.sent4: His sudden departure disrooted her sense of security.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds disrooted the fragile flowers from the soil.

meanings.definition: To remove or destroy the roots of.
meanings.sent1: The construction disrooted the plants along the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The invasive species disrooted the native vegetation in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy gardener accidentally disrooted the entire row of tulips.
meanings.sent4: The harsh chemicals disrooted the stubborn weed from the lawn.
meanings.sent5: The flood disrooted the trees along the riverbank.

meanings.sent1: The new policy disrooted the outdated practices in the company.
meanings.sent2: The revolution aimed to disroot the corrupt government.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's mission was to disroot all evil from the city.
meanings.sent4: The discovery disrooted the long-standing beliefs of the community.
meanings.sent5: The cure disrooted the disease from the patient's body.
